Reuters exclusively reported that Indian officials have held heated discussions with Google, Twitter and Facebook for not proactively removing what they described […]

The post Reuters reveals In heated meeting, India seeks tougher action from U.S. tech giants on fake news appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters exclusively reported that Indian officials have held heated discussions with Google, Twitter and Facebook for not proactively removing what they described as fake news on their platforms, the government’s latest altercation with Big Tech. The officials, from the Ministry of Information and Broadcasting, strongly criticized the companies and said their inaction on fake news was forcing the Indian government to order content takedowns, which in turn drew international criticism that authorities were suppressing free expression.

item.title: Reuters reveals Qatar seeks guarantees that emergency gas stays within EU
item.dc:creator: Jaime-Lee Charles
item.description:
Reuters broke the news that top gas producer Qatar is asking the European Union to restrict resales of gas outside the bloc […]

The post Reuters reveals Qatar seeks guarantees that emergency gas stays within EU appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters broke the news that top gas producer Qatar is asking the European Union to restrict resales of gas outside the bloc if it wants Qatar and other major gas suppliers to provide emergency supply in case of a Russia-Ukraine conflict. Qatar has also requested an EU resolution to a 2018 probe into its long-term contracts, which the European Commission had said might be inhibiting the free flows of gas in Europe and its single gas market. The requests made by Qatar go to the core of the EU’s gas market liberalization. The EU sees totally free trade of gas as essential to energy security, but major producers and some gas consumers say the reforms of the past two decades have often wreaked havoc and led to higher prices.

The post Reuters reveals Qatar seeks guarantees that emergency gas stays within EU appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters reveals U.S. diabetes deaths top 100,000 for second straight year
item.dc:creator: Jaime-Lee Charles
item.description:
Reuters exclusively reported that more than 100,000 Americans died from diabetes in 2021, marking the second consecutive year for that grim milestone […]

The post Reuters reveals U.S. diabetes deaths top 100,000 for second straight year appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters exclusively reported that more than 100,000 Americans died from diabetes in 2021, marking the second consecutive year for that grim milestone and spurring a call for a federal mobilization similar to the fight against HIV/AIDS. The new figures come as an expert panel urges Congress to overhaul diabetes care and prevention, including recommendations to move beyond a reliance on medical interventions alone. A report released earlier this month calls for far broader policy changes to stem the diabetes epidemic, such as promoting consumption of healthier foods, ensuring paid maternal leave from the workplace, levying taxes on sugary drinks and expanding access to affordable housing, among other areas.

The post Reuters reveals U.S. diabetes deaths top 100,000 for second straight year appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.content:encoded:
Reuters exclusively reported that Russia’s military buildup near Ukraine has expanded to include supplies of blood along with other medical materials that would allow it to treat casualties, in yet another key indicator of Moscow’s military readiness. Current and former U.S. officials say concrete indicators — like blood supplies — are critical in determining whether Moscow would be prepared to carry out an invasion if Russian President Vladimir Putin decided to do so.

item.content:encoded:
Reuters reported exclusively that the U.S. government has held talks with several international energy companies on contingency plans for supplying natural gas to Europe if conflict between Russia and Ukraine disrupts Russian supplies. Citing U.S. officials and industry sources, the report noted that the discussions were led by senior advisor for energy security Amos Hochstein.

The post Reuters exclusively reveals Biden weighing cuts to 2022 ethanol blending mandate proposal appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters exclusively reported that the Biden administration is considering lowering the 2022 ethanol blending mandate amid backlash from the oil refining lobby and unions arguing the shrinking U.S. ethanol industry can no longer support the target. President Biden is finding it hard to live up to his vow to bring some normalcy back to the sector after his predecessor, Donald Trump, took unprecedented steps to relieve refiners from the requirement.

item.title: Reuters reveals Baby lost in chaos of Afghanistan airlift found, returned to family after long ordeal
item.dc:creator: Jaime-Lee Charles
item.description:
Reuters broke the news that an infant boy, handed in desperation to a soldier across an airport wall in the chaos of […]

The post Reuters reveals Baby lost in chaos of Afghanistan airlift found, returned to family after long ordeal appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters broke the news that an infant boy, handed in desperation to a soldier across an airport wall in the chaos of the American evacuation of Afghanistan, has been found and was reunited with his relatives in Kabul on Saturday. The baby, Sohail Ahmadi, was just two months old when he went missing on Aug. 19 as thousands of people rushed to leave Afghanistan as it fell to the Taliban. Following a Reuters exclusive published in November with his pictures, the baby was located in Kabul where a 29-year-old taxi driver named Hamid Safi had found him in the airport and took him home to raise as his own.  

The post Reuters reveals Baby lost in chaos of Afghanistan airlift found, returned to family after long ordeal appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

Reuters exclusively reported that the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) appeared unprepared to assume full responsibility for the nation’s […]

The post Reuters exclusively reveals U.S. health agency may be unprepared to take over COVID vaccine program appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters exclusively reported that the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) appeared unprepared to assume full responsibility for the nation’s COVID-19 vaccine program, including activities currently managed by the Pentagon. The report cites a failure to ensure HHS has enough staff or a clear timeline for taking over those additional responsibilities. Additionally, the report found HHS had not ensured “it has sufficient workforce capacity” nor arranged “a schedule to manage the remaining vaccine development, manufacturing and distribution activities,” risking a loss of capabilities. 

The post Reuters exclusively reveals U.S. health agency may be unprepared to take over COVID vaccine program appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters reveals Trump to launch his social media app in February; market reacts

item.description:
Reuters revealed that former President Donald Trump’s new media venture, which Digital World has agreed to merge with, plans to […]

The post Reuters reveals Trump to launch his social media app in February; market reacts appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters revealed that former President Donald Trump’s new media venture, which Digital World has agreed to merge with, plans to launch its social media app Truth Social on Feb. 21. TRUTH Social, the Trump Media & Technology Group (TMTG) alternative to Twitter, offers features to follow other people and trending topics, according to demo photos. Its message equivalent of a tweet will be dubbed “truth.” The launch is expected to be the first of three stages in TMTG’s development. The second would be a subscription video-on-demand service called TMTG+ with entertainment and news.

The post Reuters reveals Trump to launch his social media app in February; market reacts appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters reveals India likely to trim fiscal deficit target as Omicron cases rise
item.dc:creator: Jaime-Lee Charles
item.description:
Reuters revealed that India is aiming for a fiscal deficit of 6.3% to 6.5% of gross domestic product for the next financial […]

The post Reuters reveals India likely to trim fiscal deficit target as Omicron cases rise appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters revealed that India is aiming for a fiscal deficit of 6.3% to 6.5% of gross domestic product for the next financial year, a less ambitious target than previously planned as COVID-19 infections threaten the economic recovery. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman is due to unveil the 2022/2023 federal budget on Feb. 1. Officials said the thinking was that sharp cuts in government expenditure could hurt growth prospects. India’s case load of coronavirus infections is surging, fueled by the Omicron variant and the worry is that consumer and business spending will be hit, leaving the government with little choice but to step in. 

The post Reuters reveals India likely to trim fiscal deficit target as Omicron cases rise appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
